description: From Middle English squamous, from Latin squāmōsus, from squāma (“scale”).

adjectives.description: squamous (comparative more squamous, superlative most squamous)

entries.meaning: Covered with, made of, or resembling scales; scaly.
examples: Synonyms: squamose, squamulose; see also Thesaurus:scaly

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Of or pertaining to the squamosal bone; squamosal
